citations.narrative:
A prairie dog had escaped through multiple hot wires, and a gate gap of approximately 2 inches (the gate attaches to the
wall bolts to allow it to swing open/close) in the outdoor enclosure. The prairie dog was observed by facility staff outside of
its enclosure and staff attempted to capture the animal. The animal evaded net capture and was eventually caught in a
culvert off property. The animal was unable to be removed safely and was euthanized following Veterinary Protocol. The
facility must ensure that all housing facilities are maintained in such a manner to protect and contain the animals within.
The facility has reconfigured the wires at the gate attachments.
* Corrected at time of inspection on 7/22/2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Critical
   
Facilities, general. 
A prairie dog had escaped through multiple hot wires, and a gate gap of approximately 2 inches (the gate attaches to the 
wall bolts to allow it to swing open/close) in the outdoor enclosure. The prairie dog was observed by facility staff outside of 
its enclosure and staff attempted to capture the animal. The animal evaded net capture and was eventually caught in a 
culvert off property. The animal was unable to be removed safely and was euthanized following Veterinary Protocol. The 
facility must ensure that all housing facilities are maintained in such a manner to protect and contain the animals within.  
The facility has reconfigured the wires at the gate attachments. 
 
* Corrected at time of inspection on 7/22/2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
